name: Modules.CoreMotion.Gyroscope
summary: Allows Titanium client applications to access CoreMotion's Gyroscope APIs.

methods.name: getGyroData
methods.summary: Returns the latest sample of gyroscope data.
methods.description: An app that is receiving gyroscope data after calling startGyroUpdates with no callback, needs to periodically check the value returned by this method and process the gyroscope data.

methods.name: isGyroActive
methods.summary: Returns a Boolean indicating whether gyroscope updates are currently happening.

methods.name: isGyroAvailable
methods.summary: Returns a Boolean indicating whether a gyroscope is available on the device.

methods.name: setGyroUpdateInterval
methods.summary: The interval in milliseconds, for providing gyroscope updates to the callback.

methods.name: startGyroUpdates
methods.description: If a callback is passed to this method, it will be called whenever there is an update. The frequency of these updates can be controlled using the <Modules.CoreMotion.setGyroUpdateInterval> method. If no callback is passed, the gyroscope data can be accessed using the getGyroData method. To stop the delivery of events, call the stopGyroUpdates method. Note: It is recommended to set an update interval of at least 250ms before, to avoid receiving too many callbacks at once.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: The method to be called when there is an update.
